contextId.information: The people ask this question to express their amazement. The question could be changed to an exclamation. AT: "All of these Galileans could not possibly know our languages!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_exclamations]])
contextId.quote: Really, are not all these who are speaking Galileans?

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this is a rhetorical question that expresses how amazed they were or 2) this is a real question for which the people wanted an answer. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why is it that we are hearing them, each in our own language in which we were born?

contextId.information: Peter asks this question to emphasize that they should not be surprised by what had happened. AT: "you should not be surprised" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: why do you marvel?

contextId.information: The Jewish leaders ask this question out of frustration because they could not think of what to do with Peter and John. AT: "There is nothing that we can do with these men!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: What shall we do to these men?

contextId.information: Peter uses this question to rebuke Ananias. AT: "you should not have let Satan convince you to lie ... land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: why has Satan filled your heart to lie ... land?

contextId.information: Peter used this question to rebuke Ananias. Here the word "heart" refers to the will and emotions. AT: "You should not have thought of doing this thing" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: How is it that you thought of this thing in your heart?

contextId.information: Peter asks this question to rebuke Sapphira. AT: "You should not have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: How is it that you have agreed together to test the Spirit of the Lord?

contextId.information: Moses asked this question to encourage them to stop fighting. AT: "you should not hurt each other!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: why are you hurting one another?

contextId.information: This question was used to rebuke Moses. AT: "You have no authority over us!" See how you translated this rhetorical question in [[:en:bible:notes:act:07:26|7:27]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Who made you a ruler and a judge?

contextId.information: God asks this question to show that man did not create anything. AT: "My hand made all these things!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Did my hand not make all these things?

contextId.information: This question was asked to state emphatically that he could not understand without help. AT: "I cannot understand unless someone guides me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: How can I, unless someone guides me?

contextId.information: The eunuch uses this question as a way of asking Philip for permission to be baptized. AT: "Please allow me to be baptized" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: What prevents me from being baptized?

contextId.information: This rhetorical question communicates a rebuke to Saul. In some languages a statement would be more natural (AT): "You are persecuting me!" or a command (AT): "Stop persecuting me!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: why are you persecuting me?

contextId.information: Peter uses this question to convince the Jewish Christians that the Gentile believers should be baptized. AT: "No one should keep water from these people! We should baptize them because they have received ... we!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Can anyone keep water from these people so they should not be baptized, these people who have received ... we?

contextId.information: Paul uses this question to rebuke Elymas for opposing God. AT: "You are always saying that the truth about the Lord God is false!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: You will never stop twisting the straight paths of the Lord, will you?

contextId.information: Barnabas and Paul are rebuking the people for trying to sacrifice to them. AT: "Men, you must not worship us!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Men, why are you doing these things?

contextId.information: Paul uses a question to emphasize that he will not allow the magistrates to send them out the city in secret after they had  mistreated Paul and Silas. AT: "I will certainly not let them send us out of the city in secret!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Do they now want to send us away secretly? No!

contextId.information: This question was asked to exhort Paul to be baptized. AT: "Do not wait!" or "Do not delay!" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: why are you waiting?

contextId.information: The men use this question to scold Paul for what he has said in [[:en:bible:notes:act:23:01|23:03]]. AT: "Do not insult God's high priest!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Is this how you insult God's high priest?

contextId.information: Paul uses a question to challenge the Jews present. They believe God can raise the dead but do not think God brought Jesus back to life. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "You should not think it is incredible that God brings a dead person back to life." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Why should any of you think it is incredible that God raises the dead?

contextId.information: Paul asks this question to remind Agrippa that Agrippa already believes what the prophets said about Jesus. This can be expressed as a statement. AT: "You already believe what the Jewish prophets said, King Agrippa." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
contextId.quote: Do you believe the prophets, King Agrippa?
